children.children: JSter is a catalog of frontend JavaScript libraries. We also maintain [a blog](/blog/) and publish [a monthly newsletter](http://eepurl.com/zB_g5). If you want to find a library for some specific purpose, we probably have something for you.

JSter is a spiritual successor to JSwiki established by Juho Vepsäläinen. JSter started out as a collaboration between Juho and the Codegyre development team: Michael Bodnarchuk and Nick Palamarchuk. We took the technology they had developed for Symfohub and then retrofitted it.
You can get in touch by using [Twitter](https://twitter.com/jsterlibs) or [email](bebraw@gmail.com).
